title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Monday, 25 April 2016 - BBC News
summary: a man is arrested on sus of murder over the death of a woman at a property in wisbech .
three men are arrested on sus of attempted murder after a peterborough man was dragged along lincoln road by a car .
peterborough united chairman darragh macanthony says sacking manager graham westley was `` very tough '' .

documents.title: our coverage through the day
text: live updates have finished for today .
we 'll be back tomorrow with the latest news , sport , weather and travel for cambridgeshire from 08:00 .
do n't forget you can get involved with our live page at any time by sending us your stories and via email , facebook or twitter .

documents.title: weather : overnight showers , becoming increasingly windy
text: showers will clear for a time this evening leading to a breezy and cold night with patchy frost .
minimum temperature : -1c ( 30f ) .
after a chilly start , tomorrow will see a mixture of sunny spells and scattered showers .
some of these showers will be heavy with the risk of hail , sleet and thunder .
for a more detailed forecast for where you live , head to bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: music from the middle ages performed for first time in 1,000 years
text: ancient songs have been performed for the first time in 1,000 years after being `` reconstructed '' by a cambridge researcher .

cambridge university 's dr sam barrett has reconstructed melodies from the 11th century after more than two decades of painstaking work , deciphering lost techniques used to set down tunes in the middle ages .
`` there have been times while i 've been working on this that i thought i 'm in the 11th century , when the music has been so close it was almost touchable , '' he said .
hear the result for yourself above .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cambridgeshire charity rebuilds homes destroyed in nepal earthquake
text: one year on from the nepal earthquake , a team from the mountain trust , based in great shelford , is rebuilding homes in a destroyed village .

virtually none of the 800,000 buildings razed in the quake have been rebuilt , with bbc south asia correspondent justin rowlatt describing it as a `` country of tarpaulins , tents and tin-roofed shacks '' .
the mountain trust is rebuilding about 50 homes in a remote village in rural nepal .
the first six house frames have been assembled ( above ) with the next batch in production .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : murder arrest after woman 's body found in wisbech cambridgeshire charity rebuilds homes destroyed in nepal earthquake
text: here are the top stories in cambridgeshire this evening :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: two people arrested following death of man in peterborough released on bail
text: a man and a woman arrested on friday in connection with the death of a man in peterborough have been released on bail until 20 may .
a 46-year-old-man , from peterborough , was arrested on sus of murder and a 43-year-old woman , also from the city , was arrested on sus of perverting the course of justice .
it follows the death of a man in his 40s on park farm way , stanground , on 15 april .
police say a post mortem-examination concluded his death was from `` injuries consistent with a fall from height '' .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bhs staff in cambridgeshire face uncertain future after retailer calls in administrators
text: staff at branches of british home stores ( bhs ) in peterborough 's queensgate centre ( below ) and the grafton centre in cambridge are facing an an uncertain future , after the retailer filed for administration today .
administrator duff & phelps will now try to find a buyer for all or part of the 88-year-old business , but in the meantime bhs will continue to trade .
if a buyer is not found , it would be the biggest high street collapse since woolworths in 2008 .
for the latest developments head to bbc business live .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: football : cambridge united 's play-off hopes remain alive after victory over notts county
text: cambridge united 's play-off hopes remain alive after their 1-2 victory over notts county - but it depends on afc wimbledon not beating portsmouth tomorrow night .
manager shaun derry praised the 700 fans who made the trip to watch the victory against his former club , describing away support this season as `` consistently brilliant '' .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: man who died following longstanton crash named by police
text: a man who died following a crash in longstanton on saturday has been named by police as dishant patel , who lived in the village .
the 25-year-old was a back seat passenger in a black bmw alpina which left the b1050 at 21:25 .
he was taken to addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge where he died from his injuries .
the driver and front seat passenger , both men in their 20s , suffered minor injuries .

documents.title: senior addenbrooke 's doctors sign letter reassuring patients of 'safe care ' during strike action
text: more than 160 senior doctors at addenbrooke 's have signed a letter reassuring all patients they will still receive `` safe and appropriate '' care during the junior doctors strike .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: a1 blocked near southoe following three-vehicle crash
text: the a1 is blocked at southoe following a crash involving a lorry and two vans .
the east of england ambulance service said the drivers of all three vehicles were treated at the scene for non-serious injuries .
they were described as `` walking wounded '' .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: 'do n't run over mr sainsbury 's ' , cat 's owners plead
text: a cat whose penchant for supermarket shopping has made him a hit on social media nearly lost one of its nine lives in the store 's car park .
`` mr sainsbury 's '' - aka garfield - has become a firm facebook favourite as he spends most days entertaining ely shoppers or lolling on their car bonnets .
however , a recent near-miss prompted his owners to beg fans to check behind their vehicles after he was nearly run over .
an eagle-eyed shopper spotted him in time and rushed to his rescue .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: chinese students arrive to study at thomas deacon academy
text: ten year 7 chinese exchange students from suzhou foreign language school in the jiangsu provence , china , arrived at thomas deacon academy on monday of last week to start their experience of life in an english school .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: national trust completes wicken fen 'bridge for nature ' for ponies and cattle
text: ponies and cattle will soon be able to roam freely between grazing pastures at a cambridgeshire nature reserve after a special bridge was completed .
the £ 200,000 `` bridge for nature '' links two areas at wicken fen currently separated by a road .
it will allow grazing animals , including wild konik ponies ( above ) - introduced from eastern europe - to roam freely between the two areas of the national trust 's wetland reserve .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cold and breezy with some showers
text: skies should brighten a little this afternoon and the showers will ease for a time .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
the skies may be grey , but oilseed rape is colouring the landscape yellow across cambridgeshire .
this was the scene near cambridge earlier captured by bbc weather watcher 'ebb & flow ' .
you can send us your .
via email , facebook or twitter .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: headlines : murder arrest after woman 's body found in wisbech three arrested after man dragged along road by car in peterborough
text: if you are just joining us , here are the top stories in cambridgeshire this morning :
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: darragh macanthony : sacking graham westley 'very tough '
text: peterborough united owner darragh macanthony told me sacking manager graham westley was `` very tough '' .
he was the chairman 's seventh manager in nine-and-a-half years .
darragh macanthony said the next manager needs to be someone `` with a solid reputation '' .
you can watch a full video interview on our facebook page .
author: Nick Fairbairn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: peterborough united : next managerial appointment 'critical ' , says darragh macanthony
text: peterborough united chairman darragh macanthony says his next managerial appointment is `` critical '' after sacking graham westley .
former stevenage boss westley was dismissed following saturday 's 2-0 home defeat by scunthorpe - their fourth loss in five league games .
`` we 've got a terrible home record , we 've lost 10 home games this season and it 's cost us the play-offs .
that in turn lost us probably 30 % of our gate , '' macanthony told bbc radio cambridgeshire .
author: Phil Shepka
BBC Sport

documents.title: wisbech murder arrest : post-mortem examination of woman due to take place this afternoon
text: cambridgeshire police say a post-mortem examination of a woman found dead at a home in wisbech is due to be carried out at peterborough city hospital at 15:00 today .
a 43-year-old man has been arrested on sus of murder .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: murder arrest after body of woman in her 50s found in wisbech
text: a 43-year-old man has been arrested on sus of murder after a woman 's body was found at a property in wisbech .
police were called to mill close just after 09:40 yesterday , with `` reports of concern '' for a woman in her 50s .
the arrested man is currently being treated in hospital for minor injuries .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingman arrested on sus of murder after discovery of woman 's body in wisbech
text: a man has been arrested on sus of murder following the discovery of a woman 's body at a property in wisbech on sunday morning .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: girl taken to hospital with head injury in peterborough
text: the ambulance service says a girl has been taken to hospital following an accident in peterborough this morning .

a rapid response vehicle and ambulance crew were were called to the dogsthorpe area at 07:50 , where they treated the girl - a pedestrian - for a head injury , before taking her to peterborough city hospital .
more details soon .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: man dragged along road by car remains in 'serious condition '
text: a 25-year-old man dragged along lincoln road in peterborough remains in a `` serious condition '' at addenbrooke 's hospital , according to police .
three men have been arrested on sus of attempted murder following the incident in early hours of sunday morning .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: attempted murder arrests after man dragged along road by car
text: cambridgeshire police has just told us three men have now been arrested after a 25-year-old man was dragged along lincoln road in peterborough by a car on sunday .
a 29-year-old man and a 27-year-old man , both from the city , were arrested on sus of robbery and attempted murder .
another 25-year-old man from peterborough was arrested on sus of attempted murder .
all three have been released on police bail until 10 may .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: breakingthree men arrested on sus of attempted murder in peterborough
text: three men have now been arrested on sus of attempted murder after a man in his 20s was seriously hurt when dragged along the road by a car in peterborough on sunday .
more to follow .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: cambridgeshire charity helping survivors of nepal earthquake says millions remain homeless
text: exactly a year after the devastating earthquake in nepal , `` millions '' of people remain homeless , according to a cambridgeshire-based charity helping survivors .
over the past 12 months , the mountain trust , based in great shelford , has rebuilt a school and is in the process of rebuilding a village consisting of 50 homes .

coordinator natasha malcolm-brown says : `` our team on the ground confirms there 's widespread need for basic health and shelter provisions and a year on we are renewing our campaign for support . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man seriously hurt after being dragged along by car in peterborough
text: a man in his 20s was seriously hurt after being dragged along the road by a car in peterborough in the early hours of sunday morning .
police say the man was speaking to the occupants of a dark-coloured vehicle on lincoln road when it drove off , dragging him along .
he was taken to addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge where he remains in a serious condition .
a man in his 20s has been arrested .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cheeky guerrilla cannabis gardener labels plants but 'factory ' is unearthed near cambridge
text: a brazen guerrilla gardener planted a plot of cannabis plants next to a public park near cambridge .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: row after man 'blacked up ' for show
text: an amateur dramatics theatre company has defended its show after accusations an actor 'blacked up ' during performances .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: football : peterborough united part company with manager graham westley
text: peterborough united have parted company with manager graham westley following saturday 's 2-0 defeat by scunthorpe united .
the 48-year-old took had been in charge of posh since replacing dave robertson in september and lifted the club as high as the play-off places in january .
but they have since fallen to 14th in the table and have lost four of their last five matches .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : cold and breezy with some showers
text: there will be a fair amount of cloud around this morning bringing a few light showers .
skies should brighten a little early on this afternoon and the showers will ease for a time .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
for a full forecast head to bbc weather .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: headlines : man seriously injured after being dragged along by car peterborough united part company with manager
text: here are the top stories in cambridgeshire this morning :
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: welcome to cambridgeshire live
text: good morning .
thanks for joining us at the start of another week.. as ever we 'll bring you the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates for cambridgeshire until 18:00 .
we have a full weather forecast coming next , and do n't forget you can get involved with our live page at any time by sending us your stories and via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live
